translation.en: [narrator] An extraordinary gathering took place  at Israel's Mount Herzl Cemetery
translation.ja: 2016年９月30日イスラエルのエルサレム

translation.en: in Jerusalem on September 30th, 2016.
translation.ja: ヘルツルの丘で特別な集会がありました

translation.en: An event unlike any other since the Jewish state's founding in 1948.
translation.ja: 1948年の建国以来類を見ないイベントです

translation.en: It included presidents and prime ministers, kings and queens,
translation.ja: 顔ぶれは各国の大統領や首相国王 女王

translation.en: religious leaders and international dignitaries.
translation.ja: 宗教指導者国際社会の要人など

translation.en: They had all come to attend the funeral of Shimon Peres,
translation.ja: シモン･ペレス氏の葬儀に参列しています

translation.en: Israel's ninth president, a three-time prime minister,
translation.ja: イスラエルの第９代大統領首相就任３回

translation.en: a Nobel Peace Prize laureate,
translation.ja: ノーベル平和賞受賞者

translation.en: and one of the most respected and beloved elder statesmen in the world.
translation.ja: 世界で最も敬愛される長老政治家の１人でした

translation.en: The day before, thousands upon thousands of Israelis young and old,
translation.ja: その前日 イスラエル国民が世代や背景を問わず

translation.en: from all walks of life and backgrounds, also paid their respects.
translation.ja: ペレスに追悼の念を表しました

translation.en: They had gathered to honor a man
translation.ja: 生を受けたのは

translation.en: born in a place that few, if any, had ever heard of in Central Europe,
translation.ja: 中央ヨーロッパの名もなき地でした

translation.en: assembled together in a country that did not formally exist
translation.ja: 葬儀が行われているこの国は

translation.en: when Shimon Peres arrived on its shores in 1934.
translation.ja: 1934年 ペレスが来た当時は存在しない国でした

translation.en: He was a young firebrand whose visions of the future startled his mentor,
translation.ja: 若き扇動者ペレスの構想はその師をも驚かせました

translation.en: Israel's first prime minister, David Ben-Gurion.
translation.ja: ベングリオン初代大統領です

translation.en: A sometimes controversial figure on the political scene,
translation.ja: 政界では賛否両論も呼びました

translation.en: he was a hawk who built Israel's military and then
translation.ja: イスラエル軍を作った強硬派から

translation.en: he negotiated a peace treaty and became a dove.
translation.ja: 和平交渉を経て穏健派となりました

translation.en: Active well into his 90s, Shimon Peres worked not for personal gain,
translation.ja: 90歳を過ぎても活動を続け個人の利益よりも―

translation.en: but to benefit the country he helped to found and loved until the day he passed away.
translation.ja: 創設に尽力し 愛した国の利益を重んじました

translation.en: Shimon Peres was called a dreamer.
translation.ja: 夢想家と呼ばれました

translation.en: There were times when that description was more of a criticism than a compliment,
translation.ja: 誉め言葉より主に批判からですが

translation.en: but his detractors never stopped him from continuing to dream.
translation.ja: 誰も彼の夢を止めませんでした

translation.en: People said that I'm a dreamer.
translation.ja: 私が夢想家というのは―

translation.en: It's true.
translation.ja: 本当です

translation.en: But ask me this: What's wrong?
translation.ja: 悪いことですか？

translation.en: Who said people who don't dream are right?
translation.ja: 夢を見てはいけないのか？

translation.en: [woman 1] The way he lived his life and the choices that he made
translation.ja: 彼の生き方や選択は

translation.en: based on a notion that dreams are where it starts, you know,
translation.ja: 夢を持つことが始まりという考えに基づいています

translation.en: dreams and not fantasies.
translation.ja: 幻想ではなく夢です

translation.en: [man 1] I think a lot of people sometimes found the scale of the vision too utopian,
translation.ja: 構想の規模がユートピア的と言われましたが

translation.en: but he never meant it to be something that existed only in theory.
translation.ja: 机上の空論を意図したことはありません

translation.en: For him, it was always about
translation.ja: ペレス氏にとっては常に

translation.en: uniting the theory with a very practical implementation.
translation.ja: 理論と実践の一体化がすべてでした

translation.en: [man 2] Shimon was a man of action.
translation.ja: シモンは行動の人で

translation.en: He did not waste time.
translation.ja: 時間を無駄にしない

translation.en: In his vision and as a statesman, he did tremendous things.
translation.ja: 政治家として顕著な力を発揮しました

translation.en: His original approach to things,
translation.ja: 物事への独特なアプローチ

translation.en: his different approach to things,
translation.ja: 異なるアプローチ

translation.en: he was not like all the others.
translation.ja: ほかの人と違う―

translation.en: He had his own way of thinking.
translation.ja: 独自の考えを持っていました

translation.en: [man 3] People were always amazed that no matter how old he got,
translation.ja: 老いてなお 驚きの人でした

translation.en: first, he looked good,
translation.ja: 健康そうな外見

translation.en: and he stayed young in mind.
translation.ja: 心も若いままでした

translation.en: Made him young at heart. That's how he kept going.
translation.ja: 気の若さが元気の秘訣でした

translation.en: He was able to just let go of the most unimaginable disappointments
translation.ja: 想像を絶する失望や深い落胆も―

translation.en: and the deepest frustrations...
translation.ja: やり過ごしたのです

translation.en: and he never gave up on anybody.
translation.ja: 人を見捨てなかった

translation.en: [man 4] I think this is the kind of man that teaches that leadership must be optimistic
translation.ja: 指導者は楽観的であるべきと教えられました

translation.en: and think about how to forge a better tomorrow together.
translation.ja: よりよい明日をともに築くことの大切さもです

translation.en: He was constantly
translation.ja: 常に―

translation.en: working on ways to improve the life of a lot of people.
translation.ja: 人々の生活を向上させる道を模索していました

translation.en: There were discouraging moments, but never to allow the discouraging moments to...
translation.ja: 心を砕かれることがあってもそのことで―

translation.en: cause him to retreat from doing what he loved to do.
translation.ja: 情熱を捨てたりはしなかった

translation.en: [man 5] I think that fundamental optimism in him
translation.ja: 根底にある楽観主義

translation.en: was something that was why, unlike many people
translation.ja: それが秘訣だったと思います

translation.en: who seem to fade as they get older,
translation.ja: 多くの場合 年齢とともに失われがちなものです

translation.en: he seemed to constantly draw more energy and...
translation.ja: 常にエネルギーを引き寄せ

translation.en: become more of a magnet.
translation.ja: 人を引きつけました

translation.en: Including among young people,
translation.ja: 若い層も含めてです

translation.en: as he got older,
translation.ja: 歳を重ねても お人柄は

translation.en: because he never lost that quality.
translation.ja: 変わりませんでした

translation.en: [woman 2] He was gifted with the ability to listen to others
translation.ja: 見解を共有しない人の意見を聞くこと

translation.en: who did not share his views,
translation.ja: それができる人でした

translation.en: and still remain determined to find a path forward.
translation.ja: また 進むべき道を探す決意を持ち続けていました

translation.en: President Peres was all about love and compassion.
translation.ja: ペレス大統領は愛と思いやりの人でした

translation.en: He was a giver, not a taker.
translation.ja: 受けるのではなく与える人だったのです

translation.en: [man 6] My father's life was a journey from an old land to a new land.
translation.ja: 父の人生は 古い地から新しい地への旅でした

translation.en: From an old era to a new era.
translation.ja: 旧時代から新時代へ

translation.en: Inspired by our prophets, he was a harmony of contradictions.
translation.ja: 預言に触発され内なる矛盾を抱えていました

translation.en: On one hand, very realistic.
translation.ja: とても現実的かと思えば

translation.en: On the other hand, a dreamer.
translation.ja: 夢想家でもある

translation.en: Being an optimist, being positive, using your imagination,
translation.ja: 楽観主義でポジティブ想像力が豊かで

translation.en: never giving up, always look at the future,
translation.ja: 常にあきらめず 未来を見る

translation.en: is part of the DNA of his vision.
translation.ja: どれも父の構想の礎(いしずえ)となっています

translation.en: I don't have patience to sit and watch.
translation.ja: 見守るだけでは我慢できません

translation.en: I want to be a participant,
translation.ja: 参加したいのです

translation.en: and clearly, in the march to the future.
translation.ja: そして前進していたい

translation.en: I don't like to sit on my chair
translation.ja: ただ座って十年も待ち

translation.en: and wait ten years until something new will arrive.
translation.ja: 何かが訪れるのを待つのは嫌です

translation.en: I prefer to run, to move, to think, to be surprised.
translation.ja: 走り 動き 考え 驚きを感じたい

translation.en: Always be optimistic, but never be satisfied.
translation.ja: 常に楽観的ででも満足はしない

translation.en: Go ahead.
translation.ja: 恐れずに―

translation.en: Dream.
translation.ja: 夢を見るのです

translation.en: [narrator] Shimon Peres was born Shimon Perski
translation.ja: 本名はシモン･ペルスキ

translation.en: on August 2nd, 1923, in the town of Vishneva,
translation.ja: 1923年８月２日ヴィシェニェフ生まれ

translation.en: then in Poland, now a part of Belarus, close to Lithuania.
translation.ja: 当時のポーランド現在はベラルーシ領です

translation.en: I was an exceptionally large baby.
translation.ja: ものすごく大きな赤ん坊だったそうです

translation.en: I was a sensation, if you want.
translation.ja: 驚異的な大きさで

translation.en: I almost killed my mother.
translation.ja: 母は死そうだったとか

translation.en: And to this very day, I feel apologetic about it.
translation.ja: 今でも申し訳なく思っています

translation.en: But once I was born, the doctor checked me and he said:
translation.ja: 医者が赤ん坊の私を診てこう言ったそうです

translation.en: "This boy doesn't need anything, no vaccination."
translation.ja: “予防接種の必要なし”と

translation.en: I didn't get a vaccination in my life, you know?
translation.ja: 実際受けていません

translation.en: Where I was born...
translation.ja: 私の出生地は―

translation.en: It was a small shtetl, they called it. Small Jewish village.
translation.ja: 小さなユダヤ人集落でした

translation.en: Something like a thousand souls, probably.
translation.ja: 1000人ほどの住民は

translation.en: All of them, without exception, Zionist.
translation.ja: 全員がシオニストです

translation.en: And for us, Israel was a dream.
translation.ja: イスラエルは夢の地でした

translation.en: When a package of oranges came from Israel to Vishneva...
translation.ja: イスラエルからオレンジの包みが届くとき

translation.en: it was the greatest event for all of us.
translation.ja: それは素敵なイベントでした

translation.en: They were beautifully packed
translation.ja: きれいに包まれ―

translation.en: in a sort of a silky Jaffa packing.
translation.ja: 光沢を帯びたヤッファからの荷

translation.en: And their smell was fantastic.
translation.ja: 芳香を放っていました

translation.en: [narrator] Throughout his childhood in Vishneva,
translation.ja: ヴィシェニェフでの幼少期

translation.en: one of Shimon Peres' biggest influences
translation.ja: 特に大きな影響を受けたのが

translation.en: was his maternal grandfather, Zvi Meltzer.
translation.ja: 母方の祖父ツヴィ･メルツァーです

translation.en: A disciple of the legendary rabbinical figure, the Vilna Gaon,
translation.ja: 伝説的なラビヴィルナのガオンの弟子で

translation.en: he studied and taught at the famed Volozhin Yeshiva.
translation.ja: ヴァウォジン･イェシヴァで学びました

translation.en: [Peres] He was a rabbi.
translation.ja: 祖父はラビで―

translation.en: He knew by heart the Bible, the Talmud, all the others,
translation.ja: 聖書やタルムードなどを暗記していました

translation.en: but he was also playing the violin.
translation.ja: バイオリン奏者でもありました

translation.en: He took me under his wings.
translation.ja: 私をよく面倒見てくれました

translation.en: I think I was the preferred grandchild he has had.
translation.ja: 気に入りの孫だったのでしょう

translation.en: He started to teach me, at the age, probably, of three or four,
translation.ja: 勉強が始まったのは私が３～４歳のころでした

translation.en: every day a page of the Talmud.
translation.ja: タルムードを毎日１ページ

translation.en: He suggested to me to read even Russian literature.
translation.ja: ロシア文学を読むようにも薦められました

translation.en: He told me to read The Brothers Karamazov of Dostoyevsky.
translation.ja: ドストエフスキーの「カラマーゾフの兄弟」です

translation.en: There were weeks I couldn't fall asleep, you know?
translation.ja: 何週間も眠れなかった

translation.en: Imagine a child reading this terrible book.
translation.ja: 子供であんな本を読んだからです

translation.en: [man 2] The second person who very much influenced his early life
translation.ja: そのころ ２番目に影響が大きかったのが―

translation.en: was his mother Sara.
translation.ja: 母のサラです

translation.en: She was a librarian and she actually instilled into him
translation.ja: 図書館員で 彼に感化を与えました 図書館員で 彼に感化を与えましたペレス伝記の公式執筆者マイケル･バー･ゾウハー

translation.en: the love for books, for literature.
translation.ja: ペレス伝記の公式執筆者マイケル･バー･ゾウハー本や文学への愛好心です

translation.en: [Peres] She read in three languages:
translation.ja: 母は３カ国語が読めました

translation.en: Russian, Yiddish and Hebrew.
translation.ja: ロシア イディッシュへブルです

translation.en: And she taught us the classics of Yiddish and the classics of Hebrew.
translation.ja: イディッシュ語やへブル語の古典も教わりました

translation.en: And it was our bread and butter.
translation.ja: それが日課でした

translation.en: [narrator] Following in his grandfather's footsteps,
translation.ja: 祖父にならい

translation.en: young Shimon was devoutly religious, far more than his own father.
translation.ja: シモンは父よりも強い信仰心を持っていました

translation.en: You know, in the shtetl, there wasn't electricity.
translation.ja: 地元の集落には電気がありません

translation.en: My father was well-to-do,
translation.ja: 父は裕福だったので

translation.en: so he brought a radio working on batteries.
translation.ja: 電池式のラジオを買いました

translation.en: [narrator] One Saturday, Shimon returned from the Sabbath prayers
translation.ja: ある土曜日安息日の礼拝から戻ると

translation.en: to find his father listening to the radio.
translation.ja: 父がラジオを聴いていました

translation.en: I became outraged and I broke the radio.
translation.ja: 私は怒ってラジオを壊しました

translation.en: "How dare do you play on a Saturday?"
translation.ja: “安息日の土曜にラジオを聴くとは！”

translation.en: [Michael Bar-Zohar] If you want to understand Shimon's character,
translation.ja: シモンの性格をよく表す―

translation.en: you have to go back to when he was four, five.
translation.ja: ４～５歳当時の話があります

translation.en: He came once to his grandmother's home with another child.
translation.ja: ある日 祖母の家に友達を連れてきました

translation.en: The boy was stocky, strong, much stronger than he was.
translation.ja: 体格がよくて力の強そうな男子です

translation.en: And they played a game,
translation.ja: ２人は―

translation.en: one was going to throw the other on the ground.
translation.ja: 互いを投げ合う遊びをしていました

translation.en: And the other was stronger, so he threw Shimon on the ground.
translation.ja: シモンは その強い友達に投げ飛ばされました

translation.en: Shimon got up and said in Yiddish: "An andere mal,"
translation.ja: そして起き上がりこう言ったのです

translation.en: "another time."
translation.ja: “もう一度”

translation.en: So they do the second time.
translation.ja: ２回目もまた

translation.en: "An andere mal."
translation.ja: “もう一度”

translation.en: Third time, fourth time.
translation.ja: ３回 ４回と対戦し

translation.en: Finally, the grandmother said, "Shimon, that's enough.
translation.ja: 祖母が言いました “もうやめて 彼はお前より強い”

translation.en: He's stronger than you."
translation.ja: “もうやめて 彼はお前より強い”

translation.en: And Shimon said, "No, perhaps next time I'll win."
translation.ja: すると“次は勝てるかもしれない”

translation.en: And that's Shimon Peres from then until this very day. "Perhaps next time I'll win."
translation.ja: シモン･ペレスという人間をよく表す言葉です

translation.en: [narrator] Shimon Perski had a carefree childhood,
translation.ja: 屈託のない子供時代でした

translation.en: swimming in the Olshansky River that ran behind his house
translation.ja: 家の裏にあるオルシャンスキー川で

translation.en: with his friends and his younger brother Gershon or Gigi, as he became known...
translation.ja: 友達や弟のギギことゲルションと泳いだものです

translation.en: The forests surrounding Vishneva
translation.ja: ヴィシェニェフの森は

translation.en: provided their father, Yitzhak, with a good living as a lumber merchant.
translation.ja: 材木商の父に豊かな生活を約束しました

translation.en: But in the early 1930s, Polish authorities began to levy special taxes
translation.ja: 1930年代になり 当局は 父の事業に特別な税を課します

translation.en: against Yitzhak Perski's lumber business because he was Jewish.
translation.ja: 当局は 父の事業に特別な税を課します ユダヤ人だったからです

translation.en: It became almost impossible for him to make a living.
translation.ja: もはや生活は支えられません

translation.en: In 1932, he decided he had no choice
translation.ja: 1932年 父は移住を決意します

translation.en: but to leave Vishneva for Palestine, Eretz Israel,
translation.ja: 行き先はパレスチナのエレツ･イスラエル

translation.en: where his brother and other family members had already moved.
translation.ja: 兄弟や親せきがすでに住んでいました

translation.en: He would set up a new lumber business there
translation.ja: 新事業が落ち着き次第

translation.en: and send for his wife Sara and his sons once he was making enough money.
translation.ja: 妻サラや息子たちを呼び寄せる計画でした

translation.en: Not long after Yitzhak's departure,
translation.ja: 父の移住後まもなく

translation.en: a member of the Jewish community was brutally murdered
translation.ja: 地元の森で殺人が起きました

translation.en: by an anti-Semitic gang in one of the nearby forests.
translation.ja: 反ユダヤ集団の仕業です

translation.en: And there was a picture of him in the papers.
translation.ja: 新聞に犠牲者の写真が載っていました

translation.en: All of us were alarmed.
translation.ja: 皆 不安になりました

translation.en: [narrator] So alarmed that they decided to leave for Palestine as soon as they could.
translation.ja: そして 早急にパレスチナへ移る決断をします

translation.en: A few months later, Shimon, Gigi, and Sara
translation.ja: 数か月後 シモン ギギサラは

translation.en: gathered at the train station outside of Vishneva.
translation.ja: 郊外の駅に集まりました

translation.en: Among those who came to the station to say goodbye
translation.ja: 見送りにきた１人に

translation.en: was his grandfather, Zvi Meltzer.
translation.ja: 祖父のツヴィがいました

translation.en: [Peres] He stood aside quietly.
translation.ja: 祖父は静かにたたずみ

translation.en: When the locomotive arrived, he came close to me, embraced me,
translation.ja: 汽車が着くと 私にこう言いました

translation.en: and told me: "My son, I have just one request from you.
translation.ja: “お前に頼みたいことはただ１つ”

translation.en: Remain Jewish."
translation.ja: “ユダヤ人であれ”

translation.en: He embraced me, and that was the last time I saw him.
translation.ja: 私を抱きしめ…それが祖父に会った最後です

translation.en: [narrator] Sara, Shimon, and Gigi arrived in Jaffa Harbor via Istanbul in British Mandatory Palestine
translation.ja: ３人はイギリス委任統治領ヤッファに到着しました

translation.en: in the summer of 1934.
translation.ja: 1934年の夏でした

translation.en: [Peres] It was like arriving in a different planet, you know?
translation.ja: 別の惑星に着いたようでした

translation.en: Nothing was alike in Jaffa and Vishneva.
translation.ja: 故郷とは少しも似ていません

translation.en: My father came with a boat,
translation.ja: 父が船でやってきました

translation.en: because there wasn't a port, with Arab sailors.
translation.ja: 港はなく アラブ人の水夫がいました

translation.en: But the first sensation was the sky.
translation.ja: まず感動したのが 空です

translation.en: I never saw in my life a blue sky, blue, totally blue,
translation.ja: あんなに真っ青な空を生まれて初めて見ました

translation.en: and the sun, so warming,
translation.ja: そしてあの太陽　暖かくて―

translation.en: and the smell of the oranges, which is like perfume.
translation.ja: 芳(かぐわ)しいオレンジの香りがしていました

translation.en: People were not dressed as heavily as we were.
translation.ja: 人々は 私たちのように厚着をせず

translation.en: They were lightly dressed.
translation.ja: 薄着でした

translation.en: They were sunburned.
translation.ja: 日焼けした―

translation.en: They were strong.
translation.ja: 強靭(じん)な身体

translation.en: And for the first time,
translation.ja: そして初めて―

translation.en: I came to a place where everything was written in Hebrew.
translation.ja: ヘブライ語だらけの場所にやってきました

translation.en: Imagine coming from a place
translation.ja: かつて住んでいた場所では

translation.en: that you didn't see any Hebrew language
translation.ja: 見たこともありません

translation.en: to a place there is only Hebrew languages.
translation.ja: ヘブライ語環境への移住です

translation.en: It's like, you know, I was jumping from one world to another world. I couldn't believe it.
translation.ja: 別の世界へ飛び移ったようで信じられませんでした

translation.en: I was reborn. And I was happy.
translation.ja: 生まれ変わったようで幸せでした

translation.en: That I don't have the words to describe it.
translation.ja: 言葉では 言い尽くせません

translation.en: My dream came true,
translation.ja: 夢が叶ったのです

translation.en: and the dream was by far more beautiful,
translation.ja: その夢ははるかに美しかった

translation.en: more fascinating, more optimistic, more than I ever had dreamed.
translation.ja: 想像よりもずっと魅力的で楽観的なものでした

translation.en: [narrator] Shimon enrolls in sixth grade at the Balfour School in Tel Aviv.
translation.ja: シモンは テルアビブのバルフォア校６年に編入し

translation.en: He immediately stands out among other students,
translation.ja: すぐに頭角を現しました

translation.en: but for the wrong reasons.
translation.ja: 別の理由で…です

translation.en: I knew Hebrew perfectly,
translation.ja: ヘブライ語は完璧でしたが

translation.en: but with the Ashkenazi accent.
translation.ja: 東ヨーロッパの訛りがありました

translation.en: So a little bit at the beginning, the students were laughing at me.
translation.ja: 当初は 生徒に笑われました

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He wanted to be a sabra. He had an accent from which he didn't get rid until today, actually.
translation.ja: イスラエル出身者とは違う訛りは抜けませんでした

translation.en: And that was the one thing which he didn't like about my biography.
translation.ja: 私の書いた伝記でもその記述が気に入らず

translation.en: He called me once and he said, "Who told you I have a Polish accent?"
translation.ja: “ポーランド訛りがあると誰が言った？”と

translation.en: I said, "Shimon, nobody has to tell me that. I hear it." "You hear it! Who told you?"
translation.ja: “聞けばわかる”と言うと怒っていました

translation.en: Then he met a friend whose father convinced him
translation.ja: その後 友だちの父親に説得され

translation.en: to go to the agricultural school in Ben Shemen.
translation.ja: ベン･シェメン農業学校に進学します

translation.en: And then he saw his life, his future, in agriculture.
translation.ja: 将来は農業に携わるつもりでした

translation.en: He says once he wanted to be a farmer
translation.ja: 夢は 農業労働者または―

translation.en: or a poet to the stars.
translation.ja: 詩人だと言っていました

translation.en: [narrator] "The most important service to the people of Israel
translation.ja: “この国に一番必要なのは”

translation.en: is building the country by working the land,"
translation.ja: “土地を使った国造りだ”

translation.en: writes then 15-year-old Shimon Perski in an essay,
translation.ja: 15歳のシモンは作文にそう書いています

translation.en: "Why I Aspire to Study and Live in Ben Shemen."
translation.ja: 題名“ベン･シェメンで学ぶ理由”

translation.en: "My place is not in the city," he insists,
translation.ja: “私の居場所は都市ではなく”

translation.en: "but in the village behind the plow, in the field."
translation.ja: “畑や農具のある村にある”

translation.en: He also becomes a leader in one of the most popular Zionist youth movements in the country,
translation.ja: そしてシオニスト青年運動のリーダーとなります

translation.en: HaNoar HaOved, "The Working Youth."
translation.ja: “働く若者”という組織です

translation.en: Shimon's activism soon brings him to the attention
translation.ja: その活動は注目されました

translation.en: of the chairman of the Jewish Agency, the leader of the Haganah,
translation.ja: ユダヤ機関の代表で軍事組織ハガナーを率いる

translation.en: and perhaps the most important figure in labor Zionism, David Ben-Gurion.
translation.ja: 労働シオニズムの重要人物ダヴィド･ベングリオンです

translation.en: [Peres] So, one day I got a message from Ben-Gurion that he would like to meet me.
translation.ja: ベングリオン氏が 私に会いたいと言うことでした

translation.en: He was my hero, but I didn't dream to meet him.
translation.ja: ヒーローに会えるなんて夢のようでした

translation.en: And he suggested that I should join him in his car
translation.ja: テルアビブからハイファまで車の中で話そうと

translation.en: from Tel Aviv to Haifa.
translation.ja: 提案してくれました

translation.en: I was very excited.
translation.ja: 心が躍りました

translation.en: It was a winterly day.
translation.ja: テルアビブベングリオン邸寒い日でした

translation.en: I came to his place, and I came in the car.
translation.ja: 車に乗るとベングリオンは―

translation.en: He fell asleep.
translation.ja: 眠りました

translation.en: There was no end to my disappointment,
translation.ja: あまりにも残念でした

translation.en: because there was no end to my expectations.
translation.ja: ひどく期待しすぎたからです

translation.en: Well, when we came near Haifa,
translation.ja: ハイファに近づくと

translation.en: all of a sudden he opened his eyes, looked at me.
translation.ja: 突然眼を開けこちらを見ました

translation.en: I'm not sure he knew who I am.
translation.ja: 私が誰か分からず

translation.en: He tried to think, "Who is that young boy here?"
translation.ja: “この青年は？”と考えたようです

translation.en: And all of a sudden he says:
translation.ja: こう言いました

translation.en: "You know, Trotsky was not a great leader."
translation.ja: “トロツキーは優れた指導者でなかった”

translation.en: How did Trotsky enter the car at the last part of our voyage?  I don't know.
translation.ja: なぜ急にトロツキーの話になったか分かりません

translation.en: [narrator] Ben-Gurion then proceeded to lecture Shimon
translation.ja: そしてレーニンほど

translation.en: on why Trotsky was not as effective a leader as Lenin because he was unable to make decisions.
translation.ja: よい指導者でない理由は決断力のなさだと言いました

translation.en: At the end of the sentence, he fell asleep,
translation.ja: その後また眠りに落ち

translation.en: and that was the end of our trip.
translation.ja: それきりでした

translation.en: During the evening and night,
translation.ja: 昼夜を問わず

translation.en: the Arabs used to shoot at our village.
translation.ja: アラブ人は 我々の集落に向け発砲しました

translation.en: We were surrounded all around by Arab villages.
translation.ja: アラブ人の集落に囲まれていたのです

translation.en: So during the night, I was on the watch.
translation.ja: 私は夜間の監視を務めていました

translation.en: And that happened to be very near the home of Sonya.
translation.ja: その近くに住んでいたのがソーニャです

translation.en: [narrator] Sonya is the daughter of Ben Shemen's carpentry teacher,  Yakov Gelman.
translation.ja: ソーニャは ベン･シェメンの工芸教師の娘でした

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He saw this girl coming out of the house  with one of the teachers,
translation.ja: 家から出てきたこの女性に目がとまりました

translation.en: and she had this gorgeous Greek profile,
translation.ja: 華やかなギリシャ風の風貌

translation.en: and she was with short pants,
translation.ja: ショートパンツを穿(は)いていました

translation.en: and he looked at her and he fell in love.
translation.ja: ひと目ぼれでした

translation.en: And that was total. He was very much in love.
translation.ja: 激しい恋に落ちたのです

translation.en: [narrator] October 1939.
The Nazis invade Poland, and World War II begins.
translation.ja: ポーランド侵攻で第二次世界大戦が開戦

translation.en: The British government issues a decree known as the White Paper,
translation.ja: 〝パレスチナ白書〞 イギリス政府が白書を発表

translation.en: strictly limiting Jewish immigration to Palestine,
translation.ja: ユダヤ人はパレスチナ移住を制限され

translation.en: making it impossible for Jews to flee Nazi-occupied Europe.
translation.ja: ナチス占領下の欧州から脱出不可となりました

translation.en: David Ben-Gurion proclaims,
translation.ja: ベングリオンの言葉

translation.en: "We will help the British as if there were no White Paper,
translation.ja: “白書に目をつむり英国軍を助け”

translation.en: and fight the White Paper as if there were no war."
translation.ja: “戦争に目をつむり白書と戦う”

translation.en: For this reason, thousands of Jews in Palestine
translation.ja: パレスチナのユダヤ人は

translation.en: soon enlist in the British Army to fight the Nazis.
translation.ja: ナチスと戦うため英陸軍に入隊

translation.en: Among them, Shimon's father Yitzhak, who is soon captured by the Germans.
translation.ja: シモンの父もその１人でドイツ軍に捕らえられました

translation.en: For most of the war, the family has no idea if he's dead or alive.
translation.ja: 一家は戦争中 彼の生死も知りませんでした

translation.en: While some join the Haganah and its elite fighting division, the Palmach,
translation.ja: ある者はハガナーや精鋭部隊パルマッハに入隊し

translation.en: to continue resisting the British mandatory authority,
translation.ja: 委任統治に抵抗し続けました

translation.en: Shimon and many others choose a different path.
translation.ja: シモンは別の道を選びました

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He didn't want to enlist in the British Army.
translation.ja: 入隊を望まなかったのです

translation.en: There was a slogan in Palestine at that time among the Jews.
translation.ja: 当時 ユダヤ人のスローガンが

translation.en: "Some to the arms and some to the land."
translation.ja: “軍へ行く者と地へ残る者”でした

translation.en: And he preferred to build the kibbutz they were creating at the time.
translation.ja: 彼はキブツを作る道を選んだのです

translation.en: Kibbutz Alumot in Galilee.
translation.ja: ガリラヤのアルモットです

translation.en: And that's the time when Sonya, his girlfriend, left him.
translation.ja: ソーニャはシモンの元を去り

translation.en: She went to British Army.
translation.ja: イギリス軍に入隊します

translation.en: And he stayed and they separated.
translation.ja: ２人は離れ離れになりました

translation.en: [narrator] January 20th, 1942.
A top secret meeting of high-ranking Nazis is taking place in a villa
translation.ja: ナチス幹部による極秘会議が

translation.en: a few thousand miles away on picturesque Lake Wannsee, outside of Berlin.
translation.ja: ベルリン郊外ヴァンゼーの邸宅で開かれました

translation.en: The topic of their discussion:
translation.ja: 議題は―

translation.en: the implementation of what will soon be called
translation.ja: ある計画の実施でした

translation.en: The Final Solution of the Jewish Question.
translation.ja: “ユダヤ人問題の最終解決”です

translation.en: In just a little over an hour and a half, these Nazi officials
translation.ja: １時間半ほどの会議で 死の収容所の設置が定められました

translation.en: formalize the procedures that set up death camps such as
translation.ja: 死の収容所の設置が定められました アウシュビッツ ソビボルトレブリンカ マイダネク

translation.en: Auschwitz, Treblinka, Sobibor, and Majdanek
translation.ja: アウシュビッツ ソビボルトレブリンカ マイダネク

translation.en: in the systematic murder of millions of European Jews.
translation.ja: 欧州にいるユダヤ人の組織的大量虐殺です

translation.en: Four days later on January 24th,
translation.ja: ４日後の１月24日

translation.en: Shimon leads an expedition of the working youth, which he's organized,
translation.ja: ペレスは若者を率いて遠征に出かけます

translation.en: to the ancient fortress of Masada,
translation.ja: マサダ遺跡は１世紀に―

translation.en: the site of the famous First Century Jewish rebellion against the Romans.
translation.ja: ユダヤ人がローマ帝国に蜂起した場所です

translation.en: The British Mandatory Authority does not want Jews making pilgrimages to Masada
translation.ja: イギリス委任統治当局はユダヤ人のマサダ巡礼および

translation.en: and has banned Jews from traveling to this area.
translation.ja: 地域への訪問を禁じました

translation.en: So the group is risking arrest.
translation.ja: 逮捕は覚悟の上でした

translation.en: Their mission is to rebuild the paths going to the top of Masada,
translation.ja: 標高450ｍの頂上への道を

translation.en: 1,500 feet above sea level, that had been destroyed in an earthquake.
translation.ja: 地震の被害から建て直すことが使命でした

translation.en: [Peres] We saw some parts of the roads,
translation.ja: 道の片りんが残っていました

translation.en: and I said: "Look, I think this is the way to the top."
translation.ja: 私は“頂上への道かも”と言い―

translation.en: I started going. I made one curve.
translation.ja: たどり出しました カーブから―

translation.en: I found a connection to the other curve.
translation.ja: 次のカーブへと…

translation.en: When I came to the fourth curve, the curve disappeared.
translation.ja: ４番目のカーブで先を見失いました

translation.en: So I was hanging in the middle.
translation.ja: 宙ぶらりんの状態です

translation.en: And stones began to fall, and there was a danger to my life.
translation.ja: 岩が落ちてきて生命の危険にさらされました

translation.en: [narrator] His friends go into action.
translation.ja: 友人らが早速

translation.en: They climb to the top of Masada and make a human ladder, each person holding the legs of the other
translation.ja: 頂上から次々に足を掴み人間のはしごを組みました

translation.en: until the last is able to offer his legs to Shimon.
translation.ja: シモンの元に届くまで

translation.en: And they started to carry me up to the top.
translation.ja: こうして 私は頂上まで運ばれました

translation.en: Needless to say that for a day or two I couldn't walk.
translation.ja: 数日間は歩けませんでしたが

translation.en: But there we were sitting and learning what happened in Masada.
translation.ja: マサダでの出来事を見直し分析ができました

translation.en: [narrator] At the very end of their expedition,
translation.ja: 遠征の最後に 一団は

translation.en: the group leaves a parchment scroll for future visitors to see.
translation.ja: 未来の訪問者へ宣誓の言葉を残します

translation.en: It proclaims, "Masada will never fall again."
translation.ja: “マサダは二度と陥落せず”

translation.en: Eight months later,
translation.ja: ８カ月後

translation.en: Shimon's beloved grandfather, Reb Zvi Meltzer,
translation.ja: シモンの愛する祖父ツヴィとその家族 そして―

translation.en: along with his grandmother, his uncle, and the remaining Jews of Vishneva,
translation.ja: シモンの愛する祖父ツヴィとその家族 そして― ヴィシェニェフのユダヤ人がシナゴーグに幽閉されます

translation.en: are rounded up and locked inside the shtetl synagogue,
translation.ja: ヴィシェニェフのユダヤ人がシナゴーグに幽閉されます

translation.en: which is then set on fire. They're all burned alive.
translation.ja: そして 生きたまま焼き殺されました

translation.en: The Perski family will not learn of their fate until after the war's end.
translation.ja: ペルスキ一家は終戦まで知りませんでした １９４２年８月３日ヴィシェニェフにて １９４２年８月３日ヴィシェニェフにて

translation.en: Shimon quickly becomes a leader at Alumot,
translation.ja: シモンの率いるアルモットは

translation.en: the kibbutz he and his friends are building on a mountain overlooking the Galilee.
translation.ja: ガリラヤ湖を望む山麓に建てられたキブツです

translation.en: He is elected general secretary and then treasurer.
translation.ja: 書記長そして財務長官を歴任しました

translation.en: Shimon Perski also becomes a rising star in the youth movement of Mapai,
translation.ja: シモンはマパイの新星でもありました

translation.en: the labor party faction under Ben-Gurion's leadership.
translation.ja: ベングリオン率いる労働党の一派です

translation.en: He's given an old Triumph motorcycle so he can travel in the Jezreel Valley,
translation.ja: 古いオートバイでエズレルの谷を回り

translation.en: recruiting new members,
translation.ja: 新メンバーを勧誘

translation.en: and spend two days a week in Tel Aviv conferring with party leaders.
translation.ja: 週２日テルアビブで幹部と話し合いました

translation.en: At the beginning of 1945,
translation.ja: 1945年初頭

translation.en: David Ben-Gurion gives him a special assignment:
translation.ja: ベングリオンが命じました

translation.en: mapping and exploring the Negev Desert all the way down to Eilat,
translation.ja: エイラートまでネゲヴ砂漠を地図化せよと

translation.en: looking ahead to it becoming part of a future Jewish state.
translation.ja: ユダヤ人国家建設の準備でした

translation.en: And when we were going, we saw in a very high tree an eagle.
translation.ja: その道中 とても高い木にワシがとまっていました

translation.en: I saw it and immediately climbed the tree.
translation.ja: 私はすぐさま木に登りました

translation.en: Its Hebrew name is "Peres."
translation.ja: ヘブライ語で「ペレス」

translation.en: It was there where I changed my name.
translation.ja: 改名の由来です

translation.en: [narrator] Not long after the now Shimon Peres returns to Alumot,
translation.ja: シモン･ペレスがアルモットに戻って間もなく

translation.en: a special guest arrives at the kibbutz.
translation.ja: 特別な訪問客がありました

translation.en: Sonya, who has finished her British Army service.
translation.ja: 兵役を終えたソーニャです

translation.en: He remained in touch with her over the years, writing letters about Alumot
translation.ja: シモンはキブツの建設や生活について

translation.en: and the life they were building in the Galilee.
translation.ja: 手紙で知らせていたのです

translation.en: He never gave up hope that they might reunite and invited her to visit.
translation.ja: 再会をあきらめずソーニャに訪問を促しました

translation.en: The two fall deeply in love once again and resume their relationship.
translation.ja: ２人は再び激しい恋に落ち復縁しました

translation.en: [Peres] May the 1st... supposed to be the last day of war, 1945.
translation.ja: 1945年５月１日が終戦ということで

translation.en: And Sonya and myself decided to get married.
translation.ja: ソーニャと私は結婚を決めました

translation.en: In the kibbutz, it was in the open air.
translation.ja: キブツでの野外結婚式に―

translation.en: There were hundreds of people coming over from the vicinity.
translation.ja: 近隣から多くの人がお祝いに来てくれました

translation.en: Kibbutzim and moshavim.
translation.ja: 入植村の人々です

translation.en: And we were happy.
translation.ja: 幸せでした

translation.en: [narrator] Their honeymoon consists of a few nights  down the hill from Alumot,
translation.ja: 新婚旅行はヨルダン川の岸辺で

translation.en: on the banks of the Jordan River in a tent set up as a gift by their fellow kibbutzniks.
translation.ja: 贈り物のテントを張って数日間 キャンプをしました

translation.en: Missing from the wedding party is Shimon's father Yitzhak,
translation.ja: 父のイツハクは 終戦時の欧州で

translation.en: who's been found alive in Europe at the war's end
translation.ja: 生存が確認されました

translation.en: after escaping several German POW camps. He is stuck in England
translation.ja: ドイツの捕虜収容所を脱走後イギリスに留まり

translation.en: and would return as Sonya and Shimon's honeymoon was ending.
translation.ja: ２人の旅行直後に帰還します

translation.en: In the summer of 1946, Shimon becomes a new father
translation.ja: 1946年の夏シモンは父となります

translation.en: as Sonya gives birth to their daughter Zvia,
translation.ja: 娘のツヴィアが誕生したのです

translation.en: who they nickname Zviki.
translation.ja: 愛称はツヴィキ

translation.en: A few months later,
translation.ja: 数か月後

translation.en: David Ben-Gurion summons Shimon to Haganah headquarters in Tel Aviv.
translation.ja: ベングリオンよりハガナーに呼ばれます

translation.en: The Jewish agency head wants a young man with his leadership skills on staff.
translation.ja: 指導力のある若い人材を探していたのです

translation.en: [Peres] And they promised it will be for a year's time.
translation.ja: 任期は１年との約束でした

translation.en: And I had my... still, my Triumph.
translation.ja: バイクに乗っていたし

translation.en: And I was Triumphing on Fridays back home.
translation.ja: 週末には それで帰宅していました

translation.en: But this year lasted 20 years.
translation.ja: しかし それは20年続いたのです

translation.en: [narrator] May 14th, 1948.
Great Britain ends its mandate in Palestine,
translation.ja: イギリスが委任統治を終了

translation.en: six months after the United Nations passes a resolution
translation.ja: 国連が ユダヤ人とアラブ人の国家を

translation.en: declaring two states in the territory, one Jewish and one Arab.
translation.ja: 創設する決議を可決させた半年後でした

translation.en: It also withdraws its troops.
translation.ja: 軍も撤退しました

translation.en: The Jews accept the resolution, the Arabs do not.
translation.ja: 合意したのはユダヤ側だけでした

translation.en: Later that day, the Jewish People's Council assembles
translation.ja: 同日 ユダヤ国民評議会が

translation.en: and declares the establishment of a Jewish state to be called Israel,
translation.ja: ユダヤ人国家イスラエルの創設を宣言します

translation.en: with its capital in Jerusalem.
translation.ja: 首都はエルサレム

translation.en: In the days leading up to these events,
translation.ja: その数日前

translation.en: David Ben-Gurion summons Shimon Peres to his office.
translation.ja: ベングリオンはペレスを呼びます

translation.en: [Peres] Ben-Gurion said: "We are going to have a war."
translation.ja: “戦争になるだろう”と言われました

translation.en: And then he took out a piece of paper from his jacket, from his pocket,
translation.ja: 彼は 上着のポケットから紙切れを出しました

translation.en: and he gave me a list, how many rifles we have, how many...
translation.ja: 銃器の数などのリストでした

translation.en: He says: "With that, we shall lose the war.
translation.ja: “これでは勝てない”

translation.en: Go and do everything you can.
translation.ja: “何でもやれ”

translation.en: Smuggle, steal, produce, buy.
translation.ja: “密輸 盗み 製造 輸入”

translation.en: Everything is permitted."
translation.ja: “何をしても許す”と

translation.en: [narrator] May 15th the following day, as Ben-Gurion has predicted,
translation.ja: 翌５月15日ベングリオンの予想どおり

translation.en: the Arab League declares war and attacks the new Jewish state.
translation.ja: アラブ連盟がイスラエルを侵攻します

translation.en: [Peres] To our great surprise,
translation.ja: 驚きました

translation.en: the United States, Great Britain and France
translation.ja: アメリカ イギリスフランスが

translation.en: decided to put an embargo on arms against the Middle East,
translation.ja: 中東への武器禁輸を決定したのです

translation.en: but the Russians weren't part of it,
translation.ja: ロシアは違った

translation.en: so the Arabs continued to get arms, and we were alone.
translation.ja: それで アラブは武器を得て我々は孤立無援でした

translation.en: [narrator] As the war rages,
translation.ja: 戦争は激化

translation.en: he was in the twilight of his years, although he might not admit it.
translation.ja: ご本人は否定するでしょうがすでに晩年でした

translation.en: I took great pleasure in my friendship with this older, wiser man.
translation.ja: この分別ある大先輩との友情は大きな喜びでした

translation.en: Shimon Peres reminds us that the State of Israel,
translation.ja: ペレス氏が教えてくれました

translation.en: like the United States of America, was not built by cynics, and Shimon Peres was never cynical.
translation.ja: アメリカもイスラエルも皮肉屋の国ではありません

translation.en: It is that faith, that optimism, that belief,
translation.ja: 志(こころざし)と楽観主義そして信念があれば

translation.en: even when all the evidence is to the contrary, that tomorrow can be better.
translation.ja: すべての兆(きざし)が逆行であろうと明日への望みはあります

translation.en: That makes us not just honor Shimon Peres, but love him.
translation.ja: 教えてくれた彼を敬愛します

translation.en: His critics often claimed
translation.ja: ペレス氏の批判者はこう言います

translation.en: he was a naive, overly optimistic dreamer.
translation.ja: 無知で 過度に楽観主義な夢想家だと

translation.en: They were only wrong about the naive part.
translation.ja: 無知の部分だけ間違いです

translation.en: He knew exactly what he was doing in being overly optimistic.
translation.ja: 自分の行動を理解した上での過度の楽観であり

translation.en: He knew exactly what he was doing with his dreams.
translation.ja: 自分の行動を理解した上での夢だったのです

translation.en: If those of us who loved him from near and far
translation.ja: ペレス氏を愛した人たちそれぞれに

translation.en: accept our duty to keep his gifts alive,
translation.ja: 彼の残した贈り物を守ってほしいのです

translation.en: in his honor, I ask that we remember
translation.ja: 敬意を表し憶えていてほしい

translation.en: Shimon Peres' luminous smile.
translation.ja: あの輝く微笑みを

translation.en: And imagine.
translation.ja: そして思い描くことを

translation.en: [narrator] In 1998, Shimon Peres wrote a short book entitled
translation.ja: 「テオドール･ヘルツルと行くイスラエル架空の旅」 1998年 シモン･ペレスは短い本を著しました 1998年 シモン･ペレスは短い本を著しました

translation.en: The Imaginary Voyage,
translation.ja: 「架空の旅」です

translation.en: in which he envisioned Theodor Herzl, the founder of political Zionism,
translation.ja: シオニズム運動を興したテオドール･ヘルツルが

translation.en: returning to a land he had only visited once, now the modern state of Israel.
translation.ja: 近代国家イスラエルに帰る空想をもとにしています

translation.en: In this imagining, Shimon takes Herzl from one end of the country to the other,
translation.ja: シモンはヘルツルを誇らし気に案内します

translation.en: proudly showing the founding father what his dreams had given birth to.
translation.ja: 建国の父の夢が生んだ地を隅々まで…

translation.en: At the end of the journey, as Peres brings Herzl to the Galilee,
translation.ja: 旅の終わりにガリラヤに連れて行きます

translation.en: not far from the kibbutz he found at Alumot, he writes:
translation.ja: キブツ アルモットの近くです

translation.en: "And so, Herzl and I end our imaginary voyage.
translation.ja: “そして私たちは架空の旅を終えた”

translation.en: Joining us are the millions of all the generations who,
translation.ja: “無数のユダヤ人がやってくる”

translation.en: over the course of the centuries, made up the Jewish people.
translation.ja: “時代や世代を越えて”

translation.en: Those who lived here before the Roman rule and those who lived after.
translation.ja: “ローマ支配より前の住民後の住民もいる”

translation.en: The poets from Spain, China, and Vishneva.
translation.ja: “スペイン 中国ヴィシェニェフの詩人”

translation.en: The disciples of the Baal Shem Tov and the Vilna Gaon.
translation.ja: “高名な聖職者ラビの使徒たち”

translation.en: The survivors of the massacres during the Middle Ages and of the Shoah.
translation.ja: “中世の大虐殺やホロコーストの生存者”

translation.en: They were all gathered to listen to Herzl recite the words
translation.ja: “皆 ヘルツルの言葉を聞いている”

translation.en: that came spontaneously to his lips at the first Zionist congress in Basel.
translation.ja: “それは シオニスト会議で彼が口にした言葉だった”

translation.en: 'If you will it, it is no dream.'"
translation.ja: “意志を持てばもう夢ではない”

translation.en: [Peres] I think my real talent was to dream.
translation.ja: 私の才能は夢を見ることです

translation.en: I never accepted things as they are.
translation.ja: 今ある状態では満足できない

translation.en: You have to dream. You have to imagine.
translation.ja: 夢を見て思い描くことが大切です

translation.en: You have really to take risks, and don't be afraid.
translation.ja: リスクを冒し恐れてはなりません

translation.en: I'm telling the young people,
translation.ja: 若者たちに告ぐ

translation.en: that each of you, every girl and every boy,
translation.ja: 君たちは男女を問わず誰もが―

translation.en: are richer, and deeper, and better than you think.
translation.ja: 自分が思う以上に 豊かで思慮深くよい人間なのです

translation.en: Look in yourself.
translation.ja: 自分を見つめ

translation.en: Keep your curiosity.
translation.ja: 好奇心を保とう

translation.en: Keep your trust.
translation.ja: 自分を信じよう

translation.en: And don't be disappointed if you won't achieve it in a fortnight.
translation.ja: すぐに結果が出せなくても失望しなくていい

translation.en: No, it's a long march.
translation.ja: 長い道のりなのです

translation.en: But it doesn't mean when you are a dreamer,
translation.ja: 夢想家だからといって

translation.en: you have to dream the same thing all the time.
translation.ja: 同じ夢を見続けなくてもいい

translation.en: Now Zionism was a dream.
translation.ja: シオニズムは夢でした

translation.en: We were 2,000 years without land, in exile,
translation.ja: ２千年間 国土もなくさまよったユダヤ民族

translation.en: and Herzl dreamed that the day will come,
translation.ja: ヘルツルの夢はいつの日か―

translation.en: and we shall have a new old land, as he called it.
translation.ja: “古き新しき地”を得ることでした

translation.en: We achieved. Now we have new dreams.
translation.ja: それを達成した今生まれる新たな夢

translation.en: Maybe finally we shall come to a land
translation.ja: この国にできることは―

translation.en: that has more perfection than the land today.
translation.ja: 今よりも高い完成度を目指すことでしょう

translation.en: The search of perfection is our great voyage.
translation.ja: 完璧を求める壮大な旅です

translation.en: What I am doing is not dreaming.
translation.ja: 私は今 夢を見ていない

translation.en: What I am doing is opening my eyes.
translation.ja: 眼を開いているのです
